Description: A double-sided flask with similar Janiform heads of Harpokrates (or perhaps of a childlike Bes): he has vertical locks over his forehead and falling on each side of his face. The mouth of the vessel is intact and flare. It has two handles. Two-piece mould. Micaceous brown Nile silt, with a worn matt red slip: probably a misfired version of Memphis Black Ware.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Very close to registration no. 1879,1120.36, but not from the same mould-series: the main difference is the length of the locks of hair over the forehead. Ptolemaic, second or first century BC.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3081)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
